availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Jackson County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Nancy Cornett Combs. Father of Wiley Combs, Nicholas Combs, Nancy Combs, Garrett Combs, Lucy Combs, Andrew Combs and Melinda Combs. Farmer in Breathitt County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Breathitt County in 1850. Farmer in Jackson County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 34A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 657.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jackson County, McKee, p. 863.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Booneville, p. 306B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 16674.
"Samuel Combs (1799-1881)," Find A Grave, Memorial 87419283, accessed January 15, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87419283.
